featured.text: When the deer hear a combination of a 3-second- long recording of a deer’s snort and 20 seconds of a barking dog, they panic and flee rapidly.
It is covered with a beautiful soft, spongy bark.
Dogs bark before earthquakes; cattle predict rainfall by sitting on the ground.
This bark can be pretty thick, well over two feet in the more mature trees.
It offers an online test telling you about the brain behind the bark.

definition.en_def: The outer covering of a tree; the sound made by a dog.
definition.example: The dog began to bark loudly at the stranger.
